Violation_Type: Immigration violation - false claim to refugee status
Legal_Issue: Whether the Applicant is a genuine conscientious objector and faces persecution in Israel
Application_Facts: Applicant served three years in the Israeli army
Did not contact military committees for conscientious objector assessment
Made speculative claims about IHL violations
Court_Ruling: Federal Court upheld Immigration and Refugee Board's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Desertion from military service without formal objection process
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to refusal to serve in military
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under IRPA s.96
Assessment_Factor: Credibility, evidence of conscientious objection, risk of persecution
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s.96
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of Immigration and Refugee Board decision
Credibility_Assessment: Board and Court found Applicant lacked credibility due to inconsistencies and lack of evidence
Evidence_Used: Military service records, Applicant's testimony, claims of IHL violations
Application_Basis: Claim of conscientious objection and fear of persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Speculative claims about IHL violations, lack of engagement with military review bodies
Governing_Rule: Under IRPA s.96, refugee status requires well-founded fear of persecution based on protected grounds
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to provide credible evidence of conscientious objection or persecution risk
Harm_Assessment: Punishment for desertion does not constitute persecution
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status due to refusal to serve in Israeli military
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility and found evidence unconvincing and inconsistent
Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; Applicant did not meet criteria under IRPA s.96
Evidence_Issues: Lack of documentation, speculative assertions, inconsistent testimony
Residency_Compliance: Applicant entered Canada and made a refugee claim
Misrepresentation_Element: Not formally alleged, but credibility concerns raised
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction to review IRB decision
Evidence_Assessment: Negative â€“ insufficient to support claim
Decision_Rationale: Applicant not a genuine conscientious objector; no well-founded fear of persecution
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of corroboration, speculative claims
Legal_Standard_Applied: Well-founded fear of persecution on protected grounds under IRPA
